flagsdescription.title: 359.botsspar Approved Portability Flags
flagsdescription.header: This is the complete set of approved portability flags for 359.botsspar.
flagsdescription.flag: -I. -I./omp-tasks/sparselu/sparselu_single -I./common This flag is included automatically by Spec/object.pm.
Used for comparing sequential to parallel results, do not set.
Sets the default argument block, must not be changed for SPEC run.
Sets the default cutoff for for the first argument, must not be changed for SPEC run.
Sets the default cutoff for for the second argument, must not be changed for SPEC run.
Sets the default cutoff for for the third argument, must not be changed for SPEC run.
Defines argument repetition for BOTS if used, do not change for SPEC.
Sets the default value for for the first argument, must not be changed for SPEC run.
Sets the default value for for the second argument, must not be changed for SPEC run.
Sets the default value for for the third argument, must not be changed for SPEC run.
Describes argument block to BOTS if needed, do not set for SPEC run.
Describes first argument cutoff to BOTS if needed, do not set for SPEC run.
Describes second argument cutoff to BOTS if needed, do not set for SPEC run.
Describes third argument cutoff to BOTS if needed, do not set for SPEC run.
Describes the argument file to BOTS if needed, do not set for SPEC run.
Describes argument repetition to BOTS if needed, do not set for SPEC run.
Describes the value of the first argument, must not be changed for a SPEC run.
Describes the value of the second argument, must not be changed for a SPEC run.
Describes the value of the third argument, must not be changed for a SPEC run.
Sets the end message, cannot be changed for SPEC run.
Sets the value init types, cannot be changed for SPEC run.
Sets the name of what is being run, cannot be changed for SPEC run.
Describes elements of the BOTS test, cannot be changed for SPEC run.
Lists the paramaters of the run, cannot be changed for SPEC run.
Tells BOTS to do self timing, do not change for SPEC run.
Tells BOTS how arguments are supplied, do not change for SPEC run.
Tells BOTS if first cutoff is to be used, do not change for SPEC run.
Tells BOTS if second cutoff is to be used, do not change for SPEC run.
Tells BOTS if third cutoff is to be used, do not change for SPEC run.
Tells BOTS if argument file is used, do not change for SPEC.
Tells BOTS if argument repetition is used, do not change for SPEC.
Tells BOTS that it is using arguments, must not change for SPEC run.
Tells BOTS that it is using arguments, must not change for SPEC run.
Tells BOTS that it is using arguments, must not change for SPEC run.
Tells BOTS repetition is to be used, do not change for SPEC run.
Used to allow BOTS debugging, not to be set for SPEC runs.
This describes the model being run. Not to be changes for a SPEC run.
Sets the value of the C compiler being used, not to be set for submittable benchmark run.
Lists the date of the compile, not to be set for submittable run.
Sets the values of the C compiler flags being used, not to be set for submittable benchmark run.
Sets a message for a BOTS run, do not use for SPEC.
Defines a final cutoff value, not to be used for SPEC run.
This causes the benchmark to be run with tied tasks. Not allowed for SPEC runs.
Defines if cutoff value, not to be changed for SPEC run.
Sets the name of the kernel call, must not be changed for SPEC run.
Sets the name of the kernel results check call, must not be changed for SPEC run.
Sets the name of the kernel end call, must not be changed for SPEC run.
Sets the name of the kernel init call, must not be changed for SPEC run.
Sets the name of the sequential kernel call, must not be changed for SPEC run.
Sets the name of the kernel sequential end call, must not be changed for SPEC run.
Sets the name of the kernel sequential init call, must not be changed for SPEC run.
Sets the value of the loader being used, not to be set for submittable benchmark run.
Sets the values of the load flags being used, not to be set for submittable benchmark run.
Defines manual cutoff value, not to be changed for SPEC run.
Include file fence, do not change for SPEC run.
Internal to BOTS, include file guard, do not use.
Internal to BOTS include setting of define, not to be messed with for SPEC run.
Generic definition of OPENMP define, SPEC runs will use SPEC_OMP.
Assumes that things are being done on a linux box, which causes specific output for linux, not to be set for benchmark on the compile line.
